screen_desc: The screenshot displays a mobile screen for selecting or customizing a theme. It shows a section titled "My themes" with an option to add a new theme and a preview of the current theme. Below, there is a grid of colors that can be selected, with a checkmark indicating the active theme. A "Show more" button is visible to display additional color options. The layout suggests a simple interface for adjusting visual themes on the device.
history_actions: click on the Settings icon located at the upper left.
click on the "System" option located at the middle-lower part of the screen.
click on the "Languages & input" located at the upper left.
click on the "Virtual keyboard" settings located at the left and upper middle part of the screen.
click on the "Gboard Multilingual typing" option located at the upper left side of the screen.
click on the "Theme" located at upper middle and left.

think_action.Thought: The current screen is focused on theme selection for the mobile device. The user wants to change the appearance of the keyboard, so selecting a new theme or color is the next logical step. There is a grid of color options displayed, and the current theme is already marked with a checkmark. The user can change the keyboard look by selecting a new theme or color from this list.
Future Action Plan: Select a color from the available options to change the keyboard theme.
Optionally, the user could click 'Show more' for additional color options, if needed.
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Select a new color from the grid to change the keyboard theme.
